description:
Aspergillus novofumigatus IBT 16806 is a species of filamentous fungus belonging to the genus Aspergillus. It was first isolated from soil collected in Thailand and described as a new species in 2004.

Aspergillus novofumigatus IBT 16806 is a rapidly growing fungus that produces a dense network of septate hyphae. It typically forms greenish-gray to dark green conidial heads (conidiophores) on the surface of the colony. The conidiophores can reach up to 400 Î¼m in length and bear globose vesicles that give rise to uniseriate phialides producing abundant green-colored conidia.

Phylogenetic analysis based on DNA sequence data has shown that A. novofumigatus belongs to the Fumigati section of the Aspergillus genus, which includes several medically important species, such as Aspergillus fumigatus. However, A. novofumigatus is not considered a major human pathogen compared to A. fumigatus.

Further studies on the biology, ecology, and potential applications of A. novofumigatus IBT 16806 are ongoing to better understand this relatively new species within the Aspergillus genus.
